intro: Orthrosanthus chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean orthrosanthus, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as sorrel and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Orthrosanthus chilensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of temperate forests.
